Elected to the Florida House of Representatives.
Elected as a Republican to the US Senate.
Shares a glimpse of his idea of an alternative to the Democratic-backed DREAM Act that would appeal to Republicans.
While not going into specifics, Rubio says his plan would grant legal status - not citizenship - for those who want to study in the United States.
Delivers the Republican response in both English and Spanish to President Barack Obama's State of the Union Address.
It is the first bilingual response to the address delivered by the same person.
Responds to Obama's move to loosen the US embargo on Cuba.
Rubio says he will block any potential US ambassador to Cuba.
CNN confirms that Rubio is moving forward with preparations for a potential 2016 presidential bid.
This includes fundraising and adding finance director Anna Rogers to his PAC.
During an appearance at Miami's Freedom Tower, Rubio announces he is entering the 2016 race for president.
Rubio suspends his presidential campaign after losing the Florida primary.
Rubio announces that he will seek re-election to the Senate.
Wins re-election to the US Senate.
Facing an outraged constituent audience of school shooting survivors a week after the deadly Parkland school shooting, Rubio is the lone Republican lawmaker to attend CNN's town hall.
Rubio says he would support legislation to prevent an 18-year-old from buying a rifle and that he is reconsidering his support for large-capacity magazines.
